info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 7 at 5:34PM MDT until September 7 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS Missoula MT
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Idaho, including the following county, Idaho.
US Highway 95 near John Day Creek and Wet Gulch.
* WHEN...Until 830 PM MDT /730 PM PDT/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 533 PM MDT /433 PM PDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.4 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - US Highway 95 near John Day Creek and Wet Gulch. - https://www.weather.gov/mso/hydrology
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT /730 PM PDT/ THIS EVENING
